We back the @RNLI #RespectTheWater campaign & the #FloatToLive advice. Help us share this lifesaving message. @MCA_media @EnvAgencySW @RLSSUK @Nat_Coastwatch @swasFT @NTSouthWest @CornwallFRS @CornwallSRT @cornwallairamb @surflifesaving @DC_Police

The diggers are returning to Seaford beach! 

Phase 1 of shingle recycling starts on the 26 Oct and will take around 4 weeks to complete. 

This work is carried out by the @EnvAgencySE and is essential to help protect the town from coastal #flooding

https://t.co/b0MiqrDFXo https://t.co/PT6n9zFpgI

@IFMFish @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO Please can you share the news that we all need to make a response to the planning inspectorate asap as EDF are appealing the Environmant Agency decision to keep the AFD's in place https://t.co/EvlLXrEXdt

#Fish of the Severn Estuary are under threat. Thousands of fish will die in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an AFD is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish

Thousands of fish will be killed in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an Acoustic Fish Deterrent is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish 

https://t.co/XCDB3kT04r

Acoustic Fish Deterrents are essential in protecting wildlife from power stations on the coast¬†üêü¬†But @edfenergy don't want to build one. Send a response to the Planning Inspectorate asking them to reject EDF‚Äôs appeal at https://t.co/KJNR14FUvh üê†üêüüê°¬†#savesevernsfish @EnvAgency https://t.co/wfPjq2e301

Delivered by @bedform, Director, @EEIatHull, who is joined by @davidshukmanbbc, @BBCNews ; Emma Howard-Boyd, @EnvAgency; Bill Meredith, @BishopBurton; and Hilary Hamer, @RootedinHull.

@xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW One of my old sites and colleagues. Stay safe and keep doing great work.

tweets.text:
"We need to understand which nature based solutions work and where best to move with the next suit of measures, linking flood to other aspects of climate change." - Emma Howard-Boyd, @EnvAgency.

#TheWaterline

Emma Howard-Boyd, @EnvAgency: "Nature-based solutions deliver more jobs per dollar, are easier to maintain and are more sustainable than other solutions in the long run."

#TheWaterline https://t.co/uN8lx78A6i
@frankiecoed The EA used to monitor many more sites in headwaters. If this is coming back I am v pleased. For me I would not have randomness to it but consistency. More points and more rigorous.

Not all aspects of our sites are about #hydrometry! https://t.co/168Een6kQy
